description.narrative:
Insatsen består av en garanti som underlättar utlåning till kvinnor och småföretagare från en kommersiell bank i Etiopien, Enat Bank. USAID och Sida delar på risken som uppstår med ökad utlåning, tillsammans med Enat Bank. Genom garantin accepterar Sida och USAID under en period av 7 år hälften av de förlustrisker som kan uppstå för en portföljexpansion på upp till 10 MUSD. Den andra halvan av risken ligger kvar hos Enat Bank.
Målet med insatsen är därmed att stärka garantimottagarens möjlighet att erbjuda lån till företag som ägs eller sköts av kvinnor i Etiopien. Genom förbättrad kredittillgång väntas små och medelstora företag kunna expandera och rekrytera mer personal. Genom dessa ökade sysselsättningsmöjligheter ökar hushållsinkomsterna för nyanställda, och hela familjers ekonomiska och sociala sårbarhet minskar.
Utöver direkta och mätbara resultat som sysselsättningsskapande och inkomstökningar, i Enats fall uppskattade till 500 arbetstillfällen och 75 procent inkomstökning över 7 år, leder ökad kredittillgång och växande företag vanligen till mer indirekta vinster på samhälls- och individnivå. Exemplet på sådana indirekta resultat inkluderar ökat utbud av varor och tjänster för den etiopiska befolkningen i egenskap av konsumenter, ökad konkurrenskraft globalt i den mån de mindre företagen stärker värdekedjorna för exportprodukter, inkomster från ökade investeringar och skatteinbetalningar, samt ökad jämställdhet genom riktade förbättringar i kredittillgång för kvinnor.

The proposed intervention is a guarantee aimed at facilitating lending over 7 years to women and SMEs from a local commercial Bank in Ethiopia, Enat Bank. USAID, Sida and Enat Bank share the risks emerging from expanded credit to the targeted recipient group. Half of the risk of loss relating to the expanded loan portfolio stays with Enat bank, while Sida and USAID take on the rest. The total expected credit expansion covered under this guarantee is 10 MUSD.
Thus the overall objective of the interventions is to improve access to credit for Ethiopian women and SMEs through the recipient bank. Through better access to finance, SMEs are expected to better realize their growth potentials which are currently hampered by financial repression in Ethiopia. As recruitments are required to meet the needs for growing SMEs, incomes are expected to grow and social as well as economic vulnerability decrease for entire households of newly recruited employees.
In addition to direct outcomes such as income and employment improvements for vulnerable population segments, in Enat's case estimated to 75 percent increase in household incomes for 500 new employees, a range of more indirect benefits from credit expansion are common in financially repressed environments, such as increased access to products and services for Ethiopian people as consumers, improved global competitiveness as SMEs strengthen value chains for export products, increased incomes from investments and tax payments, as well as improved gender equality as benefits are directed at women's businesses.

description.narrative: Until December 2017, 3 loans were under coverage totaling USD 336,692. This means 3.37% utilization. (In the May 22 update, the reported utilization had increased to 9.60%.) The utilization has picked up during the summer in 2019 to approximately 16%. Two more loans have been approved in addition and will be added to the portfolio, as of August 2019. There are several loans in the pipe line that soon will be approved within the guarantee coverage.The company that was struggling with repayments during the year and was the reason for a high NPL percentage has paid back the loan. Results can so far only be indicated in terms of utilization rate. Higher level results will take a few years to materialize.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
